q: What is the primary goal of End-to-End (E2E) testing?
o: To validate the entire system flow from start to finish
To test individual functions in isolation
To check the database schema integrity
To verify the UI styling only

q: Which of the following best describes a 'User Flow' in E2E testing?
o: The path a user takes through the application to achieve a goal
The flow of data between database tables
The sequence of function calls in the backend
The hierarchy of UI components in the code

q: What does 'Headless Mode' mean in the context of browser automation?
o: Running a browser without a visible user interface
Running tests on a computer without a monitor
Testing an application that has no frontend
Executing scripts without a testing framework

q: In E2E testing, what is a 'Scenario'?
o: A specific use case or situation to be tested
A script that runs automatically on server start
A list of all possible variable values
A theoretical model of the database

q: Why is E2E testing often considered more time-consuming than unit testing?
o: It involves running the full application stack and interacting with the UI
It requires writing more lines of code per test
It can only be done manually by humans
It requires restarting the server after every assertion
